com.milk.objed
Class IntegerTextEditor

java.lang.Object
  |

        |
        +--com.milk.objed.TextEditor
              |
              +--com.milk.objed.IntegerTextEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Editable, Editor, ValueEditor
public final class IntegerTextEditor
extends TextEditor

This is an editor for integer values as text.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Constructor Detail

IntegerTextEditor

public IntegerTextEditor(ValueEditor target)
Construct an IntegerTextEditor with no value restrictions. If such restrictions are desired, use the setValueRestrictions() method.

Parameters:
target - the target for getting and setting
Method Detail

setValueRestrictions

public void setValueRestrictions(int minimumValue,
                                 int maximumValue)
Set the minimum and maximum allowed values of the field. Use Integer.MIN_VALUE and/or Integer.MAX_VALUE for the obvious purposes.

Parameters:
minimumValue - the minimum value for the field
maximumValue - the maximum value for the field
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if minimumValue is greater than maximumValue

valueToText

protected java.lang.String valueToText(java.lang.Object value)
                                throws BadValueException
Turn the given value into its text form. In this case, we just do a toString() on the argument.

Specified by:
valueToText in class TextEditor
Parameters:
value - the value to process
Returns:
the text form of the value
Throws:
BadValueException - if the value is inappropriate

textToValue

protected java.lang.Object textToValue(java.lang.String text)
                                throws BadValueException
Turn the given text into its value form. In this case, we attempt to parse it as an integer. If that fails, or if the resultant value is out of range, we throw an exception.

Specified by:
textToValue in class TextEditor
Parameters:
text - the text to process
Returns:
the value form of the text
Throws:
BadValueException - if the value is inappropriate
